<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 277, 322, 292]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 366, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Further Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 326, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 211, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 728, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 76, 144, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 677, 91]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Use standard results from the list of formulae (MF19) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 106, 648, 153]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n}(2-3 r)(5-3 r)=a n^{3}+b n^{2}+c n
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 166, 522, 184]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 89, 144, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 714, 120]]<|/det|>
(b) Use the method of differences to find \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{(2-3 r)(5-3 r)}\) in terms of \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 828, 144, 845]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 816, 479, 863]]<|/det|>
(c) Deduce the value of \(\sum_{r=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(2-3 r)(5-3 r)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 78, 532, 97]]<|/det|>
2 The cubic equation \(x^{3}+2 x+1=0\) has roots \(\alpha, \beta, \gamma\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 110, 144, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 108, 631, 127]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a cubic equation whose roots are \(\alpha^{3}-1, \beta^{3}-1, \gamma^{3}-1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 84, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 547, 102]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the value of \(\left(\alpha^{3}-1\right)^{2}+\left(\beta^{3}-1\right)^{2}+\left(\gamma^{3}-1\right)^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 523, 144, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 516, 547, 542]]<|/det|>
(c) Find the value of \(\left(\alpha^{3}-1\right)^{3}+\left(\beta^{3}-1\right)^{3}+\left(\gamma^{3}-1\right)^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 99, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 737, 95]]<|/det|>
3 The sequence \(u_{1}, u_{2}, u_{3}, \ldots\) is such that \(u_{1}=5\) and \(u_{n+1}=6 u_{n}+5\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 108, 144, 124]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 106, 638, 125]]<|/det|>
(a) Prove by induction that \(u_{n}=6^{n}-1\) for all positive integers \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 836, 144, 852]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 834, 504, 853]]<|/det|>
(b) Deduce that \(u_{2 n}\) is divisible by \(u_{n}\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 72, 562, 85]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 85, 99, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 692, 110]]<|/det|>
4 The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) is given by \(\mathbf{M}=\left(\begin{array}{ll}1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1\end{array}\right)\left(\begin{array}{ll}\cos \theta & -\sin \theta \\ \sin \theta & \cos \theta\end{array}\right)\), where \(0<\theta<2 \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 128, 144, 145]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 127, 851, 144]]<|/det|>
(a) The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) represents a sequence of two geometrical transformations in the \(x-y\) plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 157, 851, 175]]<|/det|>
State the type of each transformation, and make clear the order in which they are applied.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 560, 144, 577]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 559, 918, 577]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the value of \(\theta\) for which the transformation represented by \(\mathbf{M}\) has a line of invariant points. [7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 79, 99, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 78, 570, 100]]<|/det|>
5 The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r=\theta \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{8} \theta}\), for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant 2 \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 112, 144, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 112, 237, 129]]<|/det|>
(a) Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 408, 144, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 407, 918, 444]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the area of the region bounded by \(C\) and the initial line, giving your answer in the form \(\left(p \pi^{2}+q \pi+r\right) \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2} \pi}+s\), where \(p, q, r\) and \(s\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 243, 144, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 242, 598, 260]]<|/det|>
(c) Show that, at the point of \(C\) furthest from the initial line,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 268, 603, 297]]<|/det|>
\[
\theta \cos \theta+\left(\frac{1}{8} \theta+1\right) \sin \theta=0
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 304, 618, 322]]<|/det|>
and verify that this equation has a root between 5 and 5.05 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 435, 91]]<|/det|>
6 The points \(A, B, C\) have position vectors

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 102, 623, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{i}-2 \mathbf{k}, \quad \mathbf{i}+2 \mathbf{j}+2 \mathbf{k}, \quad 2 \mathbf{i}-\mathbf{j}-\mathbf{k}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 220, 152]]<|/det|>
respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 167, 144, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 165, 824, 184]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the equation of the plane \(A B C\), giving your answer in the form \(a x+b y+c z=d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 536, 517, 554]]<|/det|>
<pre>A point \(D\) has position vector \(\mathbf{i}+t \mathbf{k}\), where \(t \neq-2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 568, 144, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 567, 591, 585]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the acute angle between the planes \(A B C\) and \(A B D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 78, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 831, 95]]<|/det|>
(c) Find the values of \(t\) such that the shortest distance between the lines \(A B\) and \(C D\) is \(\sqrt{ } 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 84, 99, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 463, 110]]<|/det|>
7 The curve \(C\) has equation \(y=\frac{2 x^{2}-5 x}{2 x^{2}-7 x-4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 125, 144, 142]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 123, 489, 141]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 370, 144, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 369, 552, 387]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the coordinates of any stationary points on \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 678, 91]]<|/det|>
(c) Sketch \(C\), stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 570, 144, 586]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 554, 551, 596]]<|/det|>
(d) Sketch the curve with equation \(y=\left|\frac{2 x^{2}-5 x}{2 x^{2}-7 x-4}\right|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 89, 144, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 78, 702, 112]]<|/det|>
(e) Find in exact form the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\left|\frac{2 x^{2}-5 x}{2 x^{2}-7 x-4}\right|<\frac{1}{9}\).

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 72, 564, 88]]<|/det|>
